title: Physics Informed Learning for Rocket Dynamics
description: An undergraduate research project exploring physics informed and data driven modeling of rocket flight dynamics. The work investigates how neural networks can learn system behavior while explicitly respecting known physical laws, serving as fast surrogate models for simulation and analysis.
overview: This repository contains an undergraduate research project exploring physics informed and data driven modeling of rocket flight dynamics. The work investigates how neural networks can learn system behavior while explicitly respecting known physical laws.
motivation: Traditional rocket trajectory simulation relies on analytical equations solved numerically. While accurate, these approaches can be computationally heavy and difficult to integrate into learning based pipelines. Pure data driven models are flexible but often violate physical constraints. This project explores a hybrid approach where physical laws guide the learning process.
core_ideas: Learning rocket motion from simulated or generated data
Embedding physics constraints directly into loss functions
Enforcing relationships such as position-velocity consistency and velocity-acceleration consistency
Comparing physics informed models with purely data driven baselines

model_info.architecture: Shared stem with mission branches (translation, rotation, mass)
model_info.normalization: Physics-aware nondimensionalization using reference scales (L=10000m, V=313m/s, T=31.62s, M=50kg)

title: Identifying Malignant Tumors with Machine Learning
description: Using data centered around the measurement of a variety of tumors, we created 3 machine learning models and compared the performance of each in classifying tumors as malignant or benign. title: Creating Customer Segmentations Predictions App with KMeans
description: Using Pycaret to create a quick-n-easy KMeans model and deploying this model using Streamlit. Model deployed includes a GUI that enables the end user to add in a given data point to be classified into a cluster based on model predictions.
